publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7494 Joe FitzPatrick: Scotland’s Oldest Citizen—That the Parliament congratulates Mrs Catherine Masters on reaching the age of 111 years on 23 November 2010; recognises that Mrs Masters is the oldest living Scot and the only Scot now alive who was born in the 19th century; notes that Mrs Masters was born and brought up in Dundee where her father, David Cromb, was the editor of The Courier, and wishes her all the very best on her birthday.

S3M-7494 Joe FitzPatrick: Scotland’s Oldest Citizen—That the Parliament congratulates Mrs Catherine Masters on reaching the age of 111 years on 23 November 2010; recognises that Mrs Masters is the oldest living Scot and the only Scot now alive who was born in the 19th century; notes that Mrs Masters was born and brought up in Dundee where her father, David Cromb, was the editor of The Courier, and wishes her all the very best on her birthday. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bob Doris*, Alasdair Allan*, Pauline McNeill*, Jamie McGrigor*, Bill Wilson*, Nanette Milne*, Jim Hume*, Maureen Watt*
S3M-7494 Scotland’s Oldest Citizen (lodged on 25 November 2010) Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Sarah Boyack*, Brian Adam*, Sandra White*
S3M-7494 Scotland’s Oldest Citizen (lodged on 25 November 2010) Hugh O’Donnell*, Angela Constance*, Liam McArthur*, Christina McKelvie*
S3M-7494 Scotland’s Oldest Citizen (lodged on 25 November 2010) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-7494 Scotland’s Oldest Citizen (lodged on 25 November 2010) Robin Harper*, Marlyn Glen*
S3M-7494 Scotland’s Oldest Citizen (lodged on 25 November 2010) Linda Fabiani*
